original: It puts the ball in the net or it gets the hose again. Absolutely amazing, have nothing negative to say about this game as it's exceeded my expectations and will probably exeed yours too. Fluid movement, bug/crash free, lots of story/content to put you through, options for each and every day such as multiple practices, events (sponsorships) and even games. This review is purely based on playing mycareer, and so far it's 10/10. Facescan worked really well for me (used it two times, first one made me have a downsyndrome forehead though..). Keep in mind, using the mynba2k17 app will allow for you to facescan for free and allow you to earn daily vc. #sellout
polished: It puts the ball in the net or it gets the hose again. Absolutely amazing, I have nothing negative to say about this game as it has exceeded my expectations and will likely exceed yours too. The game features fluid movement, is bug and crash-free, and offers a wealth of story content and options for each day, including multiple practices, events such as sponsorships, and games. This review is based solely on my experience with MyCareer, and so far, it's a perfect 10/10. The Facescan feature worked well for me, although the first attempt resulted in an unusual forehead shape. Using the MyNBA2K17 app allows for free Facescan and daily VC earnings. #sellout

original: Magic fans beware... Wizards is afraid to make a decent digital game. At its core magic the gathering is a social game. A game to enjoy with your friends (or frenemies) laughing, talking smack, and dropping game winning bombs. Wizards of the coast seems to have forgotten this. If you choose to play with friends you cant earn gold, and gold is important. Gold is so important that they have implemented a daily cap, understandable considering gold unlocks everything in game. But get ready for a long and boring 1v1 grind against the computer or random oponents, whom you can't even speak to. If you choose to play for free, it will take you roughly 4 hours a day for upwards of a month, by yourself, to unlock the cards.
polished: Magic fans, be warned: Wizards seems hesitant to create a decent digital game. At its core, Magic: The Gathering is a social experience meant to be enjoyed with friends, sharing laughter, playful jabs, and thrilling victories. However, Wizards of the Coast appears to have lost sight of this. When playing with friends, you're unable to earn gold, a crucial in-game currency. Gold is so vital that a daily cap has been implemented, which is understandable given its role in unlocking in-game content. But be prepared for a monotonous 1v1 grind against the computer or random opponents, with whom you can't even communicate.

original: Being the 3rd installment in the trilogy i'll get the bad stuff out of the way first. I quite hate pre-quals as it's technically going backwards in a story and not forwards (this is an issue for every pre-qual). Granted it offers more storywise. The combat feels sloppy and doesn't feel as sharp as arkham city managed to make it. As of writing this recommendation (26/10/2013) there is a game breaking bug that stops a side mission from ever being completed (main story not effected). Some gadgets are put at a rediculous hotkey that makes your hand have to travel the whole keyboard to get to it. It might sound like nothing, but while in combat it could potentially break your combo.
polished: Being the third installment in the trilogy, I'll address the drawbacks first. I generally dislike prequels, as they technically move the story backward rather than forward, which is an inherent issue with this genre. However, they often provide additional story depth. The combat feels somewhat unrefined and lacks the sharpness that Arkham City achieved. As of my writing this recommendation (26/10/2013), a game-breaking bug exists, preventing the completion of a side mission, although the main storyline remains unaffected. Some gadgets are assigned to inconvenient hotkeys, requiring excessive keyboard navigation, which can disrupt combos during combat.

original: They basically fixed shadow warrior (2013) i.e. The bossfights are awesome, weapons feel very nice (maybe not as good as d44m's ones, but still solid), enemies aren't too spongy (if you're not too much of a retard with handling elemental and upgrade stuff). The upgrade system is really balanced and once you get around it, it's not too tedious. The elemental stuff and limited ammo softly forces you to use different weapons. Lots of cool unique (being the important word here while comparing sw2 to ♥♥♥♥♥♥ borderlands' formula of 'rng' weapons) weapons that stay viable through most of the game. The music is great, especially the main theme and of course stan bush's stuff.
polished: They essentially perfected Shadow Warrior (2013). The boss fights are impressive, and the weapons feel solid, although not quite as exceptional as those in D44M. Enemies are not overly resilient, provided you effectively manage elemental and upgrade aspects. The upgrade system is well-balanced, and once you grasp it, it's not too tedious. The elemental mechanics and limited ammo encourage the use of diverse weapons. There are many unique and cool weapons that remain viable throughout the game. The music is excellent, particularly the main theme and Stan Bush's contributions.

original: So many things was made wrong. I even dont know how to start this review. This all is refered to mycareer. My player is an outside scorer, pg, 1.71m, has maxed stats and got already all necessary perks. Ok, and now tell me, why the shooting skill depends to a person's hight? why a person who has 1.74m can not became so good in shooting as a person with 1.71m? i'm 1.87m in rl, made my first player with this hight and noticed then i can not reach a higher skill than 89. Why? thats a pure discrimination! and why the game does not tell me that before i create a char and not even then when i reach the skill limit after weeks of playing?!?
polished: I'm having trouble writing this review as there are numerous issues with the game, specifically regarding my career mode experience. My player is an outside scorer, a point guard, 1.71m tall, with maxed stats and all necessary perks. However, I'm perplexed by the fact that shooting skill is tied to a player's height. It seems unfair that a player with a height of 1.74m cannot achieve the same level of shooting proficiency as someone with a height of 1.71m. In real life, I'm 1.87m tall, and when I created my first player with this height, I discovered that I couldn't exceed a shooting skill of 89. This seems discriminatory. The game should have informed me about this limitation before I created my character or at least when I reached the skill limit after weeks of playing.

original: I think this assassin's creed nailed the mechanics down on all fronts (ship battles, sailing, hunting (fish), parkour, etc). I felt much more attached to this character as well. The story starts out extremely rough but does get much much better as you play (i think this is with every ac game personally). Edward was quite the interesting character and so was all the side characters. I felt like all the collectables actually meant something in this ac game that i never got from any of the previous ones and maybe its because i felt like they had a bigger purpose in the game. They def were not required but they were fun to get and you got rewarded in a very balanced way.
polished: I think this Assassin's Creed has perfected its mechanics across the board, from ship battles and sailing to hunting and parkour. I found myself more invested in the protagonist than in previous games. Although the story begins on a rough note, it significantly improves as the game progresses - a trend I've noticed in every AC game. Edward is a fascinating character, and the supporting cast is equally well-developed. The collectibles in this game feel more meaningful than in previous installments, possibly due to their greater significance in the overall narrative. While not required, they're enjoyable to collect and reward the player in a balanced manner. The initial rough start to the story does get much better as you play. Edward and the side characters are quite interesting.

original: While i personally cannot recommend this game, it wasn't absolutely terrible. The gunplay is alright, so long as you have the money to purchase gun parts, which would be my main complaint with this game: it's pay-to-win. If i could get past that, the game would be enjoyable, as the hardsuit is fun to use and hrv is an excellent idea. I'd take this game over any call of duty title any day, but its pay-to-win microtransanction format is off-putting for me. If you are alright with this model, then by all means, have fun. But if you're like me and dislike pay-to-win games, just let this one slide; it's not our cup of tea.
polished: While I personally cannot recommend this game, it wasn't absolutely terrible. The gunplay is passable, provided you have the means to purchase gun parts. This is my primary concern with the game: its pay-to-win model. If I could overlook this, the game would be enjoyable, as the hardsuit is fun to use and the HRV concept is excellent. I'd prefer this game over any Call of Duty title, but its pay-to-win microtransaction format is off-putting. If you're comfortable with this model, then by all means, have fun. However, if you're like me and dislike pay-to-win games, it's best to avoid this one; it's not our cup of tea.

original: While not perfect, this game has been greatly enjoyable. The save system and possibility of sudden death leads to some frustration. I'm on my first playthrough and i lost my main character around hour 10 of 20ish. Would have really liked a save to reload at that point. I've since picked up a 3rd party mod/save tool to avoid catastrophic failures. Plus the aiming reticule is on the small side and zoom is underpowered. With all that said, its been a blast. I'm not normally a zombie fan, but the combination of strategy, missions, first person shooter/beat em up is great. I've been playing it as often as i can get away... Just one more mission, just one more supply run - or i'm running away and want to get safe before shutting the game down.
polished: While not perfect, this game has been greatly enjoyable. The save system and possibility of sudden death can be frustrating at times. During my first playthrough, I lost my main character around the 10-hour mark of a 20-hour campaign. A reload option at that point would have been greatly appreciated. To mitigate such losses, I've resorted to using a third-party mod and save tool. Additionally, the aiming reticule is somewhat small, and the zoom feature could be more powerful. Despite these issues, the game has been a blast. As someone who isn't typically a fan of zombie games, I've found the combination of strategy, missions, and first-person shooter/beat-em-up elements to be engaging. I've been playing it as often as I can, always looking to complete just one more mission or supply run before shutting down the game.

original: An absolute great stragtegy game! having played every single other wargame (european escalation, and alb), i have to say this one fits well. The number of units are great. Not sure exactly how many units there are, but there's a crap ton!!! graphics are just beautiful, sounds are great, and the gameplay overall is epic. The ingame chat box at the main menu is very entertaining as well, no i am not kidding. However, if anyone thinking this game is 'easy', or if you are new to the strategy genre, it could take you quite some time to get it nailed down. Do not get upset, you will lose a lot of units. Just make sure you plan ahead, always have anti-air, and anti-tank.
polished: An exceptional strategy game, in my opinion. Having played numerous other wargames, including European Escalation and ALB, I must say this one stands out. The vast array of units is impressive, with a staggering number available. The graphics are stunning, the sound effects are great, and the overall gameplay is truly epic. The in-game chat box at the main menu is surprisingly entertaining, and I'm not kidding. However, if anyone thinks this game is 'easy', or if you're new to the strategy genre, be prepared to invest time in mastering it. Do not get discouraged, as you will inevitably lose units.

original: I was negatively biased towards this game before i played it. Wasn't even sure about buying. I dunno, the whole portal gun and portals thing seemed weird to me even though i like science fiction. Boy was i wrong. The jokes and voice acting in this game is phenomenal. Just amazing. It's not cheesy (ok it's sometimes cheesy). And different story characters have all their own sense of humour. Those different characters do really have different personalities. And the level design; it's just rad. Btw i never played the first portal game. One of these days, i'm planning to if i can spare the time. I would never have played it if i hadn't played the sequel.
polished: I had a negative bias towards this game before playing it, and I was hesitant to buy it. The concept of the portal gun and portals seemed unusual, despite my fondness for science fiction. However, I was pleasantly surprised. The jokes and voice acting in this game are phenomenal, and the humor is well-balanced, occasionally bordering on cheesy. Each story character has a unique sense of humor and distinct personality. The level design is also impressive. Notably, I hadn't played the first Portal game before playing the sequel, but I plan to do so when I have the time.

original: Ok lets start on the pros(+) and cons(-) then my thoughts on this game. +some of the best charecters +good story +lods of content +customisible charecter ( you can be male or female whatever you like) +you can have a relationship with most of your companions(yes fangirls you can have a love intrest) -bad graphics ( i dont think graphics really matter anyway) -weird and akward love scenes -invisible walls -theirs one mission in my opinion was boring but everyone has different tastes -+ um this isnt really bad or good but for those who care your protaginist you made cant talk okay know for my thoughts. I love this game. This game is probubly one of the best rpgs or games in general i have ever played.so if your a rpg fan you proubly already have this game.
polished:
Let's start by weighing the pros and cons of this game, followed by my thoughts on it. 

The game has several notable advantages: it boasts some of the best characters, a compelling storyline, and an abundance of content. Additionally, the game allows for a high degree of character customization, enabling players to choose their preferred gender and appearance. Furthermore, players can develop romantic relationships with most of their companions, which is a feature that will likely appeal to fans of the genre.

However, there are some drawbacks to consider. The graphics are somewhat subpar, although this may not be a significant concern for everyone. The love scenes can be awkward and uncomfortable to watch, and the game's use of invisible walls can be frustrating at times. One particular mission may feel dull to some players, but opinions on this will likely vary. It's also worth noting that the protagonist is unable to speak, which may be a point of interest for some players.

Overall, I thoroughly enjoy this game. In my opinion, it's one of the best RPGs I've ever played, and it's likely that fans of the genre already have it in their collection.

original: Yes, this is a nostalgia trip for thirty-somethings who remember (at least in the uk) watching the ever-irritating timmy mallet just for the five minute transformers cartoon. The voice actors for optimus, megatron, bumblebee, and many others are back, and instantly recognisable. The distinctive cartoon transformation sound is there. Graphically, the cell-shaded presentation is perfect, and very, very generation one. But aside from that, it's actually a very fun game. The combat mechanics are extremely well done. Transforming mid-fight is often a necessity, and woven seamlessly into combos, making it quite unlike high moon's excellent war for/fall of cybertron games. Another distinction is the heavy focus on melee combat, but some enemies (e.g. Seekers) require a switch to a ranged blaster.
polished: This game is a nostalgic treat for thirty-somethings who recall watching the Transformers cartoon in the UK, if only to endure the annoying Timmy Mallet for those five minutes. The voice actors for Optimus, Megatron, Bumblebee, and others have returned, and their voices are instantly recognisable. The iconic cartoon transformation sound effect is also present. The cell-shaded graphics are perfect and quintessentially Generation One. Beyond the nostalgic value, the game is genuinely enjoyable. The combat mechanics are well-executed, with mid-fight transformations often being a necessity, seamlessly integrated into combos. Unlike High Moon's War for/Fall of Cybertron games, this title has a strong focus on melee combat, although some enemies, such as Seekers, require a switch to a ranged blaster.

original: So i downloaded the game and played it for a little while, and it was nothing special. I spent more time trying to log in though than actually playing the game. There is a bug where it says that there was an update to the terms of service or whatever and whenever you clicked 'accept' it would just pop up again. You have to restart the client for it to work. Now that isn't that bad but why do i need to link my steam and gface accounts? they say it is for dlc but why is that even necessary? it is also not reversable so now i know that a company i don't care about has access to my steam information. Now the game itself is so so. It is easily recognisable as a cod clone, except somehow they made the gunplay worse... How is that even possible?
polished: I downloaded the game and played it briefly, but it didn't leave a lasting impression. However, I spent more time trying to log in than actually playing. A bug kept popping up, stating that there was an update to the terms of service. Clicking 'accept' didn't resolve the issue; I had to restart the client. Although this wasn't a major issue, I was puzzled by the requirement to link my Steam and Gface accounts. The reason cited was for DLC, but I couldn't understand why this was necessary. Furthermore, this linking process is irreversible, which means a company I'm not invested in now has access to my Steam information. The game itself is mediocre. It's easily recognizable as a Call of Duty clone, but somehow the developers managed to make the gunplay worse.

original: 4k+ at 60fps (gtx 970), dual audio options and includes neptune gear. What's not to love? https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nygsb617tmo excellent port and a great entry point if new to the series. Just keep in mind there is lots of (skip-able) talking. As usual would suggest using a gamepad but personally i had no problems with a keymouse/mouse setup, both completely rebindable. Price is about right and wouldn't have been unhappy about a purchase. More then half the dlc is included free, which is still plenty to play with. Recommended game to all jrpg/anime/visualnovel fans, provided you don't mind long breaks between the action. Cheers. No commentary playlist: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=plslfvijaupszez9af395mvnk63xnhsj1_
polished: 4k+ at 60fps (GTX 970), dual audio options, and Neptune gear are all included. What's not to love? https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nygsb617tmo This is an excellent port and a great entry point for newcomers to the series. However, be aware that there are lengthy dialogue sections, which can be skipped. While a gamepad is recommended, I found the keymouse/mouse setup to be fully functional and rebindable. The price is reasonable, and the inclusion of more than half the DLC for free is a bonus. I'd recommend this game to JRPG, anime, and visual novel fans, provided they don't mind the occasional breaks in action. Cheers. No commentary playlist: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=plslfvijaupszez9af395mvnk63xnhsj1_

original: I experienced no performance problems even at release, and after all these patches it plays really well. Imo, this is a really great and fun game in truth, although the format may be somewhat annoying (where the free-roam city area repopulates with new enemies every time you progress the story). I particularly enjoyed the 'dual play' segments (where you can play batman + 1 more), and the ability to use the controller for most segments of the game but the mouse and keyboard for the tank combat segments was greatly appreciated. Driving your batmobile around the free-roam city, including when chasing the apc commanders, is actually quite enjoyable once you figure out how to use the breaks to skid around corners (and when you master that, driving around the city is really quite enjoyable!)
polished: I experienced no performance issues at release, and after numerous patches, the game runs smoothly. In my opinion, this is a great and enjoyable game, despite the somewhat frustrating format where the free-roam city area repopulates with new enemies upon progressing through the story. The 'dual play' segments, where you can play as Batman and another character, were particularly enjoyable. I also appreciated the flexibility of using a controller for most segments, while switching to mouse and keyboard for tank combat. Mastering the art of using the brakes to skid around corners while driving the Batmobile around the free-roam city, especially during APC commander chases, is quite enjoyable. Once you get the hang of it, navigating the city becomes a thrilling experience. The game's overall design allows for a seamless transition between different gameplay mechanics.

original: Damn fine aaa fps shooter - that's the bottom line. It's looks, sounds and plays great - great fps mechanics, nice story, cool characters, flawless voice acting, and a badass soundtrack. Not for the faint hearted though - some of those cutscenes were pretty darn cruel and vivid. But when a game overall is so great, it's easier to spot the flaws, and here they are as i saw 'em: - no sli support - wtf? i had to put the game away until i upgraded my card, as it ran too poorly on my old dual gpu gtx 590. Make sure you have a fairly decent single gpu card. - stupidly small obstacles are often unclimbable.
polished: This game is a damn fine AAA FPS shooter - that's the bottom line. It boasts impressive visuals, sounds, and gameplay - great FPS mechanics, a nice story, cool characters, flawless voice acting, and a badass soundtrack. However, it's not for the faint-hearted, as some cutscenes are quite vivid and cruel. When a game is overall great, its flaws become more noticeable, and here are the ones I observed: - No SLI support, which is surprising. I had to put the game aside until I upgraded my graphics card, as it ran poorly on my old dual-GPU GTX 590. Ensure you have a fairly decent single-GPU card. - Some small obstacles are unclimbable, which seems illogical.

original: English is not my native language. I am dutch. So please ignore any typing/grammatical mistakes in my review of this fantastic game. I will break down this review in a few categories: - graphics - controls - sound - gameplay - replayability - graphics: the game has been set in a comic-like style. The graphics are very slick: no unnecussery details. Nice colour-scemes. It totally works for this game. The graphics can be set on 'high' without stressing your system. I run this game on an i5 pentium processor, with nvidia geforce 710m card - 8gb memory and it runs like clockwork (windows 8.1). - controls: the game can be played with keyboard and mouse, but also with an x-box controller.
polished:
I am not a native English speaker, as Dutch is my native language. Please disregard any typing or grammatical errors in my review of this fantastic game. I will break down this review into several categories: graphics, controls, sound, gameplay, and replayability. 

Graphics: The game features a comic-like style, with very slick graphics that avoid unnecessary details. The color schemes are nice, and this aesthetic works well for the game. The graphics can be set to 'high' without putting excessive strain on your system. I run the game on an i5 Pentium processor, with an Nvidia GeForce 710m card and 8GB of memory, and it runs smoothly on Windows 8.1.

- controls: The game can be played with keyboard and mouse, but also with an X-box controller.

original: You can see by the hours i put into this game that i enjoy it. This is everything i wished a search game from cod would be. But dont buy this game thinking its like cod, battlefield, or any other shooter game. Its a game in its own class and should be treated as such. Cant tell you how many times i hear new players ♥♥♥♥♥ and complain about getting killed really fast. Oh god forbid you get shot in the face and ♥♥♥♥ing die. It's not like that doents happen in real life or anything. Edit:ok so ive been playing this game for awhile now. Thrown all kinds of money at it. One of the best mp games around. A good thing to play when your your not feeling cs:go.
polished:
The hours I've invested in this game demonstrate my genuine enjoyment. It's everything I had hoped for in a search game from the Call of Duty series. However, I must caution against purchasing this game with the expectation that it's similar to Call of Duty, Battlefield, or other shooter games. It's a unique game that deserves to be appreciated on its own terms. I've lost count of how many times I've heard new players express frustration and complain about being killed quickly. It's almost as if they're surprised to be shot and killed, despite this being a realistic outcome. 

Edit: After playing this game for a while now and investing a significant amount of money, I can confidently say it's one of the best multiplayer games available. It's a great alternative to play when you're not in the mood for CS:GO.

original: I'm 2 hours in and am dying from this game. So funny. Gameplay is also solid, art design is beautiful, music is surprisingly high quality and appropriate, the story/world has me interested, and the puzzles are fun. But the best thing about this game beyond all that is the comedy. If you've played any rpg since the dawn of video game rpgs you will laugh at the various jokes, parodies, and references; if you've never played an rpg before then you should still enjoy the game for its humor. If you played final fantasy 7 or x you absolutely need to play this game, without giving too much away... I had to actually stop playing after 2 hours to give my cheeks a break from laughing and smiling so much. What a delight so far.
polished: I'm 2 hours in and thoroughly enjoying this game. The gameplay is solid, the art design is beautiful, and the music is surprisingly high-quality and fitting. The story and world have piqued my interest, and the puzzles are entertaining. However, the standout aspect of this game is its comedy. If you've played RPGs since their inception, you'll appreciate the various jokes, parodies, and references. Even if you're new to RPGs, the humor is still enjoyable. If you've played Final Fantasy 7 or X, you owe it to yourself to play this game. I had to pause after 2 hours to give my cheeks a break from laughing and smiling so much. What a delight so far. The comedy is so funny. Gameplay is also solid, art design is beautiful, music is surprisingly high quality and appropriate, the story/world has me interested, and the puzzles are fun.

original: I'm really sorry, i try to be supportive of free-to-play games and indie developers, but i really didn't enjoy this game. The description sounded right up my alley, but the execution has done nothing for me. I love puzzle and exploration games, but i found this game to be completely unintuitive, and even after looking up how to progress i still just simply didn't find the gameplay itself fun. It also completely lacks a pause button, or if it does have one i never found it. Considering that a lot of sequences in the game are timed, this seems like a critical oversight. I also feel like this game is a lot more cut scene than it is game, and i end up just sitting around drumming my fingers a lot.
polished: I apologize, but despite my enthusiasm for free-to-play games and indie developers, I didn't enjoy this game. The description aligned with my interests, but the execution fell short. As a fan of puzzle and exploration games, I found this title to be unintuitive, and even after researching progression methods, the gameplay itself failed to engage me. A notable omission is a pause button, which seems crucial given the timed sequences. The game's balance also feels off, with an overemphasis on cutscenes that leave the player waiting idly. I often found myself waiting, feeling uninvolved in the experience. The lack of interactivity was disappointing.

original: This game.... Phew where to even start. It was absolutely beautiful, from story to graphics i was hooked. The story wasnt just some story but actually felt like i was that person, trying to figure out what came next in the story that my character was telling. Gameplay was great and i learned alot about myself through this game (mainly my fear of hights which i never had a problem with until the ice caverns). My gut churned the whole time, but i kept through for uncle fred! if you guys made a dlc or second game, i would be the first to buy it and recomend it to everyone i know. Thanks to everyone who was involved making this, you made a absolutely beautiful game.
polished: This game is truly breathtaking. From its captivating storyline to its stunning graphics, I was completely enthralled. The narrative wasn't just a generic tale, but rather an immersive experience that made me feel like I was the protagonist, eagerly anticipating the next twist in the story. The gameplay was exceptional, and I gained valuable insights about myself, particularly my unexpected fear of heights, which was triggered by the ice caverns. My anxiety was palpable, but my determination to progress for Uncle Fred kept me going. I would be thrilled to see a DLC or sequel, and I would be the first in line to purchase it, recommending it to everyone I know. Thank you to the entire team involved in creating this masterpiece; you've truly crafted a beautiful game.

original: Sid meier's civilization beyond earth is a turn-based game in which you build your civilization to a certain goal or 'victory'. In previous games you were set on the earth's timeline going through periods like the stone age, medieval age, and the modern age; however, in this game you are set in the future on a mission to colonize a new planet. What i enjoy about this game is 2k took a new approach to the game and added some new mechanics such as the affinity system and orbital layer. What i didn't enjoy was that with these new mechanics the game could be overwhelming at times. What think could be improved on this game is that they could maybe incorperate some new artwork in the game such as the enviroment you experience when communicating with another leader.
polished: Sid Meier's Civilization: Beyond Earth is a turn-based game where you build your civilization to achieve a specific goal or 'victory'. Unlike previous games, which followed the Earth's timeline through periods like the Stone Age, Medieval Age, and Modern Age, this game takes place in the future, where you're on a mission to colonize a new planet. I appreciate that 2K took a fresh approach to the game, introducing new mechanics such as the affinity system and orbital layer. However, these additions sometimes made the game feel overwhelming. One potential improvement could be incorporating new artwork, particularly in the environment experienced when communicating with other leaders.

original: Great game ! tons of replayability and very fun zombie survival game ! def. In my top 5 zombie games ever played. Edit: after playing 60+ hours i can honestly say this is one of the better more ''realistic'' zombie games. It's very much designed like a survival horror as you must save up your ammo, heal your own wounds when you bleed out, take pills when youre infected, etc. Also, i find zombies to feel very natual to be well animated for a free to play game. P.s. : i would recomend getting 1 or 2 friends to play with, but the community is super friendly and you can usually make friends/talk with the people in the chat or over voice comms.
polished: Great game with tons of replayability and a very fun zombie survival experience. Definitely in my top 5 zombie games ever played. After investing over 60 hours, I can confidently say this is one of the better, more realistic zombie games. Its design is reminiscent of survival horror, requiring you to conserve ammo, treat your own wounds, and take medication when infected. The zombies feel natural and are well-animated, especially considering it's a free-to-play game. I highly recommend playing with 1 or 2 friends, but the community is extremely friendly, making it easy to make friends or chat with others via voice comms.

original: 02/07/2014 - it's a shame i can't thoroughly recommend/enjoy this game as from the short time i've played it,i know i'd be addicted if it didn't have the following 2 game breakers. . No aussie servers - one red bar puts you at a severe disadvantage,and creates unbearable lag. Mind you,i played through the offline training mode and it was stuttering/lagging as well (how does that even happen?). Couple that with the poor ping,and it just ruins the game. . Everything artifacts like crazy - the menu's,backgrounds,training and in-game. I've never had this happen before with this card and thought it might not like my oc. Set my gpu back to stock and sure enough,it didn't make a difference.
polished: 02/07/2014 - Unfortunately, I'm unable to wholeheartedly recommend or enjoy this game due to two major issues that I've encountered during my brief playtime. I'm confident that I would be thoroughly engaged if not for these problems. Firstly, the lack of Australian servers is a significant drawback, as a single red bar results in a substantial disadvantage and unbearable lag. Notably, even the offline training mode experienced stuttering and lag, which is perplexing. The poor ping further exacerbates the issue, ultimately ruining the game. Everything is plagued by artifacts - menus, backgrounds, training, and in-game. I've never experienced this issue with my graphics card before, so I suspected it might be related to my overclock. However, resetting my GPU to its stock settings made no difference.

original: Very late last night i finished this. The story is not very deep or interesting but what makes it stand out is the story-telling. The atmosphere is filled to the brim and the many collectibles do a great job at fleshing it out. I did learn a lot about the world of batman so it was a little disappointing that so few bosses were in the game. Oh well, there's enough future games to rectify that. The combat is the right amount of challenge but it's more on the easy side. Leveling up batman wasn't very satisfying. It's the gadgets you upgrade and acquire during the campaign which add for nice new gameplay mechanics. Getting access to previously unreachable places makes for a nice sense of progression.
polished: I completed this late last night. Although the story lacks depth and interest, the storytelling is exceptional. The atmosphere is richly detailed, and the numerous collectibles effectively flesh out the world. I gained valuable insights into the Batman universe, which made the limited number of bosses somewhat disappointing. However, future games can address this issue. The combat strikes a good balance of challenge, albeit on the easier side. Leveling up Batman was not particularly satisfying. On the other hand, upgrading and acquiring gadgets during the campaign introduced enjoyable new gameplay mechanics. Accessing previously inaccessible areas created a sense of progression.

original: 'to the moon' is no mere game... Nay, it is a veritable experience, and it was one of the best of my life at that. Think telltale's the walking dead is sad? hohoho! well, it's no match for to the moon! never before have i been so depressed yet fulfilled over something purely fictional. This masterpiece represents the pinnacle of storytelling in my opinion, and the soundtrack is a gorgeously charming and perfect accompaniment. Yes, the controls are a bit finicky and the gameplay is not the strong point, but the story is so fantastic that i did not care one bit. Plus, the humor of the game is great as well and it definitely does not intrude upon the distinguished nature of the story... And the doctor who references are endless.
polished: 'To the Moon' is no mere game... Nay, it is a veritable experience, and it was one of the best of my life at that. Think Telltale's 'The Walking Dead' is sad? Hohoho! Well, it's no match for 'To the Moon'! Never before have I been so deeply moved, feeling both depressed and fulfilled over something purely fictional. This masterpiece represents the pinnacle of storytelling in my opinion. The soundtrack is a gorgeously charming and perfect accompaniment. Yes, the controls are a bit finicky and the gameplay is not the strong point, but the story is so fantastic that I did not care one bit. Plus, the humor of the game is great as well and it definitely does not intrude upon the distinguished nature of the story. The Doctor Who references are endless, adding another layer of depth to the game.

original: Bastion is a bloody brilliant game, with a really great storyline. Set after some calamity happened, you start to rebuild on the bastion. There's quite a lot of choice in the game, with the choice of what to build to give you an advantage, what weapons to use and what power ups to have on those weapons as well as what drinks to use to give you a bonus effect. The art style and music in the game is fantastic, everything looks so colourful at times, who says the apocolypse has to be dull. Best of all, the game has narration based on what you, the player do. So if you end up picking up a weapon then switch it for another in the armoury, the narration would say something of you taking along the new weapon.
polished: Bastion is a remarkably engaging game, boasting a captivating storyline. The game takes place in a post-calamity world, where you embark on rebuilding the bastion. The game offers a considerable amount of choice, allowing you to decide what to build to gain an advantage, which weapons to utilize, and what power-ups to equip them with. Additionally, you can choose from various drinks that provide bonus effects. The art style and music in the game are truly fantastic, with vibrant visuals that defy the conventional notion of a dull apocalypse. The game's narration is also noteworthy, as it dynamically responds to the player's actions.

original: I had originally bought this game in early development, when the only currency was spacebux, and there was no 'tech tree'. This was when the game was good. All of the guns at this point were equally overpowered, so there was no problems with imbalance; everyone could kill everyone at any time. Also, the game used to give you unlimited gun slots and five loadouts. You would think that for a game with 'bajillions of guns', they would at least give you more than 6 weapon slots and 3 loadouts before you have to pay to get more. At one point, i had about 3 pages worth of guns, and was planning on new ideas for more, because personally, that's where i found it fun.
polished: I initially purchased this game during its early development stages, when the sole currency was spacebux and there was no 'tech tree'. This was the period when the game truly shone. At that point, all guns were equally overpowered, eliminating any balance issues; players could engage and defeat each other at will. The game also offered unlimited gun slots and five loadouts, allowing for extensive customization. Given the game's boast of having 'bajillions of guns', it's surprising that players are now limited to just six weapon slots and three loadouts, with additional slots and loadouts available only through purchase. I once had an impressive collection of guns, spanning three pages, and was brainstorming new ideas, as this aspect of the game was where I derived the most enjoyment.

original: This game was a surprising gem. One often sees rave reviews of certain products that are often misleading. In this case, the reviews reflect the fun of this neat little game. It is an odd mix between a classic 2d platformer and an moba, and does it with style. I found myself enjoying characters that i wouldn't enjoy in other moba games. I had expected this trait to continue, but decided to give a melee tank a go anyway. I was pleasantly surprised with the outcome and ended up trying out more as they were unlocked from playing games. The art style and interface is oddly charming. As such, i now use one of the characters as my avatar and a wallpaper from creating a card set for the game.
polished: This game was a surprising gem. One often encounters rave reviews of certain products that can be misleading. In this case, the reviews accurately reflect the fun of this neat little game. It's an unusual blend of a classic 2D platformer and a MOBA, executed with style. I found myself enjoying characters that I wouldn't typically enjoy in other MOBA games. I had expected this trait to continue, but decided to give a melee tank a try anyway. I was pleasantly surprised with the outcome and ended up trying out more as they were unlocked from playing games. The art style and interface are oddly charming. As such, I now use one of the characters as my avatar and a wallpaper from creating a card set for the game. I had expected this trait to continue, but decided to give a melee tank a go anyway, was changed to I had expected this trait to continue, but decided to give a melee tank a try anyway.

original: I just started playing, but i love this game. I put on my headphone and lose myself in the game for hours at a time. It's been awhile since a game has had that effect on me. The music sets the mood, the sound effects are right on, and the controls are perfect. I look forward to every combat, and they've optimized combat extremely well. I had my doubt about the navel combat system, but it is so much fun to lay waste to multiple fleets at a time! the only way to lose in this game is to fail to retreat. If the combat looks overwhelming just get outta there, regroup, and counter-assault. Thanks, devs, for an awesome experience!
polished: I recently started playing, and I'm thoroughly enjoying this game. With my headphones on, I become completely immersed in the game for hours on end. It's been a while since a game has had such a profound effect on me. The music effectively sets the mood, the sound effects are spot on, and the controls are flawless. I eagerly anticipate every combat encounter, and the developers have optimized the combat system extremely well. Initially, I had doubts about the naval combat system, but it's incredibly fun to take down multiple fleets simultaneously. The only way to lose is by failing to retreat when necessary. If the combat appears overwhelming, it's best to regroup and launch a counter-assault. Thanks to the developers for creating an awesome experience!

original: The reboot of the devil may cry franchise has brought about many changes for the series, particularly for series’ protagonist, dante. While fans of the original series may be upset at the change to their beloved character, it’s certainly for the better; and this new game by ninja theory proves it. Dmc serves as the perfect point for newcomers to jump into the series. It shows the origins of an arrogant, cynical dante, and it chronicles his journey from cynicism to selflessness. Throughout, the game weaves a clear, narrative arc for the new dante, making him a compelling character to watch.image the story follows dante as he’s introduced into the corrupt world he willfully chose to ignore.
polished: The reboot of the Devil May Cry franchise has brought significant changes to the series, particularly for its protagonist, Dante. Although fans of the original series may be upset by the changes to their beloved character, they are undoubtedly for the better, as proven by this new game from Ninja Theory. DmC serves as the perfect entry point for newcomers to the series, showcasing the origins of an arrogant and cynical Dante and chronicling his transformation from cynicism to selflessness. The game weaves a clear narrative arc for the new Dante, making him a compelling character to watch. The story follows Dante as he is introduced to the corrupt world he had previously chosen to ignore, and his journey is one of growth and self-discovery.

original: Where do i start on this absolutely beautiful game. It's story, is absolutely charming. It has so much detail put into it, and it is a bundle of happiness, bad puns, annoying dogs, secrets. It is serious when it needs to be, but isn't a stranger to funny moments. The character design is on point, with there being various characters with various personailities and secrets to them. It sticks out from other rpg's because you don't have to kill anyone, which is an unused concept in rpg's. With lots of inspiration from earthbound, one of the best rpg's i have seen, you can tell that it is going to be good. It easily has the best soundtrack i've heard in forever.
polished: Where do I even begin with this absolutely captivating game? Its story is undeniably charming, boasting an impressive level of detail that makes it a true bundle of joy. With a perfect balance of humor and seriousness, it effortlessly navigates between heartwarming moments and laugh-out-loud humor, often courtesy of its lovable canine companions and clever secrets. The character design is impeccable, featuring a diverse cast with unique personalities and intriguing backstories. What truly sets it apart from other RPGs is its bold decision to forgo violence, a refreshing twist on the genre. Drawing inspiration from the beloved Earthbound, it's clear that this game is something special. Its soundtrack is, without a doubt, one of the best I've had the pleasure of listening to in a long time. The character design is on point, with various characters having various personalities and secrets to them. It has so much detail put into it, and it is a bundle of happiness, bad puns, annoying dogs, secrets. It is serious when it needs to be, but isn't a stranger to funny moments.

original: I am recommending this solely because it's free, and might be a more 'enjoyable' experience for others. As for my experience, the 'game' did nothing for me. Half the story relies on shock factor. I was not shocked nor emotionally moved in any way by this. Maybe i'm desensitized, or maybe it was too simple to warrant a reaction out of me. As for the other half of the game, it tries to paint a picture (literally) of a person in mental decline. It deals with obsession, hallucination, depression and a few other things. In theory it is a cool idea. But the 'game' took me 10 minutes to complete, and that is with reading and taking in every little bit of information i could.
polished: I recommend this solely because it's free and might offer a more enjoyable experience for others. However, personally, the game had little impact on me. Half of the story relies heavily on shock value, which failed to elicit an emotional response from me. I may be desensitized, or perhaps the execution was too simplistic to warrant a reaction. The other half of the game attempts to portray a person's mental decline through various themes, including obsession, hallucination, and depression. While the concept is intriguing in theory, the game's brevity and simplicity detract from its potential. I completed it in 10 minutes, taking the time to absorb every detail.

original: Do i even need to explain why portal is amazing? portal is a puzzle game, it gives you a concept then gets out. It is an amazing way to test your mind while still being fun. Although this game isn't as story heavy, it did give birth to one of the most good popular games of 2011. I still play this game and beat it when i am feeling bored and i love to come back and to see what gave birth to a legend and what is a legend. Gameplay: portal's gameplay is quite simple, to explain at least. You use portals to your advantage, along with buttons that activate a part of the puzzle. Two buttons are in the game, one that you press and one that you need a cube to put on.
polished: Do I even need to explain why Portal is amazing? Portal is a puzzle game that introduces a concept and then steps aside, allowing you to take the reins. It's an incredible way to challenge your mind while still having fun. Although this game isn't as story-driven, it did give birth to one of the most popular games of 2011. I still play this game and beat it when I'm feeling bored, and I love to come back and see what gave birth to a legend and what is a legend. Portal's gameplay is quite simple to explain. You use portals to your advantage, along with buttons that activate a part of the puzzle. Two buttons are in the game, one that you press and one that requires a cube to be placed on it. The game's simplicity is part of its charm, making it easy to pick up and play. The portal gun is an ingenious tool that allows you to navigate through the game's challenging levels. The game's design is clever, with each level carefully crafted to test your problem-solving skills. The game's world is also rich in dark humor, with a sadistic AI that guides you through the game. Overall, Portal is a game that is both fun and challenging, making it a must-play for anyone who loves puzzle games.

original: If you can overlook the bugs (which i personally only had two: one minor and the other quite annoying) edit: both bugs are resolved one fix increased my fps from 60-90 to 80-120 and are looking for a space exploration game, i can definitely recommend this. Since most of these reviews are about specs, i'll include mine: i5 6600k (~200€) radeon rx480 (~200€) z170 pro - gaming (~150€) 16gb ddr4 ram (~70€) ~650€ is definitely within the medium price range though, granted, this rig is quite new. Almost constant 60+ fps on high settings vsync enabled i genuinely can't believe 90% of the comments saying they're rocking an overkill setup and get 20fps.
polished: If you can overlook the bugs (which I personally experienced only twice: one minor and the other quite annoying), I can definitely recommend this space exploration game. Both bugs have since been resolved, with one fix significantly increasing my FPS from 60-90 to 80-120. As most reviews focus on system specs, I'll share mine: I5 6600k (~200€), Radeon RX480 (~200€), Z170 Pro Gaming (~150€), and 16GB DDR4 RAM (~70€), totaling ~650€, which falls within the medium price range. Although my rig is relatively new, I consistently achieve 60+ FPS on high settings with VSync enabled, which makes me question the numerous comments from users with overkill setups who claim to get only 20 FPS.

original: Remember age of mythology? yeah, it's been that long since there's been an rts game of such quality. Divinity: dragon commander reaches awfully close to these borders of my personal most favourite rts game. Combine this with a huge risk-like grand strategy mode and there, it hit the spot. I am not (read: try not to be) overly biased due to the fact that this game allows you to turn into a dragon, aiding your troops by supporting, attacking and even commanding unit production, direction and spawning at the very same time. Honestly, i do like the complicated rts games nowadays. Think of civ v and so on. However, such games attempt to cram complex mechanics, charts and resources all into one complicated game mode.
polished: Remember Age of Mythology? It's been that long since an RTS game of such quality has been released. Divinity: Dragon Commander comes awfully close to becoming my personal favorite RTS game. Combining this with a huge Risk-like grand strategy mode hits the spot perfectly. I try not to be overly biased, but the fact that this game allows you to transform into a dragon, supporting, attacking, and commanding unit production, direction, and spawning simultaneously, is a significant advantage. Honestly, I do enjoy complicated RTS games, such as Civilization V. However, such games often attempt to cram complex mechanics, charts, and resources into one complicated game mode, which can be overwhelming. The ability to turn into a dragon, aiding troops, is a unique feature that sets Divinity: Dragon Commander apart.

original: Undertale comes together to make something greater than the sum of its parts. The graphics are solid for a retro title and the music is nice, but paired together they make some truly beautiful and impacting moments. The script runs the gammut from comedic to dramatic to heartbreaking to hopeful, sometimes all at once, and does this while turning rpg tropes on their head. And all of this without touching on the world, characters, story, gameplay... I could write whole pages about it. But instead, i'll just say this: if you like rpgs, play this game. If you like video games, play this game. If you have seven free hours between now and your death, play this game.
polished: Undertale transcends the sum of its parts to create something truly remarkable. The solid retro graphics and pleasant music combine to produce breathtaking and impactful moments. The script masterfully navigates a wide range of emotions, from comedic to dramatic, heartbreaking, and hopeful, often simultaneously, while cleverly subverting RPG tropes. The world, characters, story, and gameplay are equally impressive, warranting extensive discussion. However, I'll simply say this: if you're an RPG enthusiast, play this game. If you enjoy video games, play this game. If you have seven free hours to spare, play this game, regardless of your gaming preferences.

original: If you liked witcher 1 and 2, witcher 3 is must to get. I would give normally for this game 10/10 but unfortunatly after 1.03 this game turned into buggy ♥♥♥♥ + random crashes, so remember to save really often. When i played version 1.00 -> 1.03 my game never crashed, i didnt see any bugs. Also i have noticed that after 1.03 patch drawing distance sometimes is horrible, starting to draw objects when youre really close, sometimes even people. But if forgetting all these bugs, crashes and drawdistance 'bugs', this is really fantastic game, they made huge effort on quests, some of them really emotional and deep, lots of side quests, and the fact that your decision effects a lot in this game. I have played over 50 hours now and still going on.
polished: If you enjoyed The Witcher 1 and 2, then The Witcher 3 is a must-have. I would normally give this game a 10/10, but unfortunately, after the 1.03 update, it became plagued by bugs and random crashes, so be sure to save frequently. When I played versions 1.00 to 1.03, my game never crashed, and I didn't encounter any bugs. However, I've noticed that after the 1.03 patch, the drawing distance can be poor, with objects and even people only rendering when you're very close. But if we overlook these issues, this is a truly fantastic game. The developers made a huge effort on the quests, some of which are emotionally deep and impactful. There are numerous side quests, and your decisions have significant effects on the game. I've played over 50 hours and I'm still going strong.

original: I have only had this game for a few months, but in just that short amount of time, two dlc's have come out, along with patches that have made an already great game into an excellent one. The devs are very active in the community, and it really shows in the various discussion forums and dev diaries. There is a fairly steep learning curve to the game's mechanics of which i am still trying to learn; however, this breadth of strategy allows you a myriad of ways to reach goals and take advantage of certain situations. The game, in my mind, is almost infinitely replayable. I find myself sucked into every session i play regardless of how the play-through is going.
polished: I've only had this game for a few months, but in that short time, two DLCs have been released, along with patches that have elevated an already great game to an excellent one. The developers are very active in the community, and their engagement is evident in the discussion forums and dev diaries. Although the game's mechanics have a fairly steep learning curve, which I'm still trying to master, this complexity offers a wide range of strategies to achieve goals and capitalize on situations. The game, in my mind, is almost infinitely replayable. I find myself sucked into every session I play, regardless of how the play-through is going. The devs are very active in the community, and it really shows.

original: Warframe is a fun game for the first few hours of play. After those few enjoyable hours you'll begin to see that the only thing left the game has to offer is repetition in it's combat, enemies and game play. The one major high point for the game is that the developers are working hard and do semi-frequent updates that generally include a lot of content from sweeping changes to some of the game's systems, new warframes and other tweaks/features. It's a good game to play casually. Though i doubt it will hold your attention beyond a few months unless you just really like grinding. The upside to all of this is that the game is free so i'd recommend trying it out. If you're looking for a quick fix, try it out.
polished: Warframe is an enjoyable game for the initial few hours of play. However, after this period, the game's limitations become apparent, with repetition in combat, enemies, and gameplay being the primary concerns. A significant redeeming quality is the developers' dedication to regular updates, which often include substantial content additions, such as sweeping system changes, new warframes, and various tweaks and features. This makes Warframe suitable for casual play. Nevertheless, its ability to sustain long-term interest is questionable, unless you have a strong affinity for grinding. Fortunately, the game is free, making it worth trying out, especially if you're seeking a brief gaming experience.

original: This game is so.. Very.. Boring. I bought this game because i believed it was a pc version of 'katamari damacy', a popular and nice ps 2 game. Sadly it's far from it. In this game you go about, absorbing ever bigger things to grow bigger and absorb bigger things. But the gameplay isn't as smooth as it could be, the levels not inventive and what is in it is a surreal horror show. I don't mean an entertaining horror show but, one that makes you rather depressed and rethink whether being alive is all it should be. Every 'living' creature in this game from small pets to human beings makes me wonder if the creators of this game had an interest in taxidermy.
polished: This game is extremely dull. I purchased it, expecting a PC version of 'Katamari Damacy', a popular and enjoyable PS2 game. Unfortunately, it falls short. The gameplay involves absorbing increasingly larger objects to grow bigger and absorb more. However, the experience is marred by poor execution, unoriginal levels, and a surreal atmosphere that's more disturbing than entertaining. The game's depiction of 'living' creatures, from small pets to humans, is unsettling and raises questions about the creators' inspirations. I was left feeling rather depressed and questioning the value of existence. The game's overall tone is bleak and uninviting. The levels lack creativity, and the gameplay is not as smooth as it could be.

original: Alright. Let me explain a few things, as a person very intrested in politics, i was very interested in this game when i first heard about it. I thought, 'oh wow! a simulator of the road to becoming president! that sounds fun!' well, it really wasn't. The game starts you off and says you need to pick a side: republican or democrat, there is no independent, or third party. A little dissapointed, but still optimistic, i carried on to see what i could do. I will give the game credit, the character customization, although limited, is pretty fun to mess around with. It's the only time its an option to wear your head or not in a campaign. Literally.
polished: As a person deeply interested in politics, I was initially excited when I first heard about this game. I thought to myself, 'A simulator of the road to becoming president? That sounds intriguing!' Unfortunately, my enthusiasm was short-lived. The game begins by asking you to choose a side: Republican or Democrat, with no option for an independent or third-party candidate. Although slightly disappointed, I remained optimistic and continued to explore the game's features. One aspect that deserves credit is the character customization, which, despite being limited, is enjoyable to experiment with.

original: Fallout 3 story was better. Settlements get in the way of the story to the point you'll hate baby sitting them instead of playing the story. Some keys are hard coded and cannot be rebound. Bugs galore. My pipboy disappeared permanently at one point and had to research console commands to get it back. You don't have to work for power armor it's basically given to you from the beginning of the game and power cores are everywhere in trader shops. Value of power armor diminished greatly from previous fallout games. Story is medicore, everything about this game is mediocre except it doesn't crash every 10 mins like fallout 3. Very stable compared to fallout 3. Is it better than fallout 3 no. Is it better than new vegas? no. This title was so overhyped for how bad it actually is.
polished: Fallout 3 had a more engaging storyline. In Fallout 4, settlements often detract from the narrative, making it feel like a chore to manage them instead of progressing through the story. Some key bindings are hardcoded and cannot be customized. The game is plagued by numerous bugs. At one point, my Pip-Boy disappeared permanently, and I had to resort to using console commands to retrieve it. Power armor is easily accessible from the start, and power cores are readily available in trader shops, greatly diminishing its value compared to previous Fallout games. The story is mediocre, and most aspects of the game are unremarkable, except for its stability, which is a notable improvement over Fallout 3. However, the game's overall quality does not surpass that of Fallout 3 or New Vegas, making it a disappointing experience despite the hype.

original: My stats (at the time of writing this review): - 8.6 hrs to get to the end - 10 collectibles found out of 25 - zero achievements out of 15 what i liked: - visuals up until the last level (ice caves) - story is not that great, but the ending (after the closing credits) kind of made me not regret so much spending my time playing this game what i disliked: - visuals in the last level are uninteresting - gameplay in the last level gets much harder making it become a frustrating experience of having to do a lot of things over and over again until you get it right - achievements are too hard. There are 13 (out of 15) that only less than 2,1% of players achieved!
polished:
My stats at the time of writing this review are as follows: 8.6 hours to complete the game, 10 collectibles found out of 25, and zero achievements out of 15. 

I enjoyed the visuals up until the last level, the ice caves, which were a notable exception. Although the story was not particularly impressive, the ending, which occurred after the closing credits, somewhat redeemed the time I spent playing the game.

However, I was disappointed with the visuals in the last level, which I found uninteresting. The gameplay also became significantly more challenging, leading to a frustrating experience of repetition until I finally succeeded. Furthermore, I found the achievements to be overly difficult, with 13 out of 15 having been achieved by less than 2.1% of players.

original: Pros: +graphic cons: -bugs(especially the environment, you may get stuck or your shots may hit a invisible wall despite having clear line of sight of the enemy) -game is handholding/ babysitting you -dumb ai -enemies always seem to know where you are when you are spotted -godlike accuracy by the enemy which is frustrating like the first ghost warrior. -terrible checkpoints and saves. -boring story that i couldn't care less about will not recommend it unless its 90% off even then i find playing this game to be an extremely boring chore, just playing for the sake of finishing it to move unto the next game in my library. polished: Pros: +graphics. Cons: -bugs, particularly environmental issues, can cause players to become stuck or encounter invisible walls, even with a clear line of sight to the enemy. -The game holds the player's hand excessively, making it feel overly guided. -Enemy AI is underwhelming. -Enemies often seem to have omniscient knowledge of the player's location once spotted. -Enemies possess unreasonably high accuracy, reminiscent of the first Ghost Warrior, which can be frustrating. The remaining issues include poorly implemented checkpoints and saves, as well as an unengaging storyline that fails to capture interest. Overall, I would not recommend this game unless it's heavily discounted, even then, playing it feels like a chore, driven solely by the desire to finish and move on to the next game in my library.

The game's complexity is part of its charm, making it a fun experience.

original: It's not hard for me to see why other people like this game, but it wasn't for me. For one thing i have a vive and i'm much more interested in playing room sized games with the controllers. Beyond that, the game is initially awe inspiring in the scale of its universe, but i also felt that same scale was a hinderence to my enjoyment. The learning curve and the amount of time to do anything interesting at the beginning were both too large for me. Perhaps if i were more patient and had more time for gaming this would be compelling to me. But i don't have either and there are plenty more vr games i'd rather spend my time on.
polished: I can appreciate why others enjoy this game, but it didn't resonate with me. As a Vive owner, I prefer playing room-sized games with controllers. Although the game's vast universe is initially awe-inspiring, I found its scale to be a hindrance to my enjoyment. The learning curve and time required to accomplish anything meaningful at the beginning were too steep for me. The game demands patience and a significant time commitment, which I couldn't provide. With numerous other VR games vying for my attention, I didn't feel compelled to invest more time in this one.

original: Hands down my favorite first person shooter of all time. Run and gun rambos need not apply. Recoil and ballistics are realistic. Single hits to the chest, neck, or head from rifle caliber weapons almost always result in death unless it just grazes you. Rounds drop over distance and short, controlled bursts are required if you wish to remain on target. There is no magical ammunition pool. If you reload half-way through your magazine all the time then you will have a pouch full of half full mags. You can't run forever. If you sprint for a while your aim will suffer as you gasp heavily until you have caught your breath. Rest your weapon on your elbows while prone or on a window sill to steady your aim. Accuracy suffers when standing.
polished: Hands down, my all-time favorite first-person shooter. However, this game is not suited for 'run and gun' players. The recoil and ballistics are remarkably realistic, making it a challenging experience. A single hit to the chest, neck, or head from a rifle-caliber weapon is often fatal, unless it's just a graze. Rounds drop over distance, and short, controlled bursts are necessary to maintain accuracy. There's no infinite ammunition pool; if you frequently reload mid-magazine, you'll end up with a pouch full of partially used magazines. You can't sprint indefinitely, as prolonged running will leave you gasping for breath, affecting your aim. To steady your aim, rest your weapon on your elbows while prone or on a window sill.

original: Let me start off by saying i did not purchase eu when it first came out and that i got it on sale which included ew so i never experienced the issues that some people claim to have had with that game. I loved that game however, it was unforgiving in the early stages but rewarding when you did things right. As for xcom2 i love it, the game plays pretty well for me on medium and i am running a gtx560 with 2gb of vram. At first the game set it to high and it was running a bit sluggishly but not to the point of being unplayable but when i dropped it down to medium it smoothed on out. Not sure if i am just lucky when it comes to having issues with games or what but it seems that most of the negative reviews sound like they are coming from some really entitled people.
polished: I didn't purchase EU when it first came out, instead opting for it on sale, which included EW. As a result, I never experienced the issues some people claim to have had with the game. I thoroughly enjoyed it, finding it challenging in the early stages but rewarding when executed correctly. In contrast, I have a positive experience with XCOM2. The game runs smoothly on medium settings, even with my relatively outdated GTX560 graphics card, which has 2GB of VRAM. Initially, the game was set to high, resulting in some sluggish performance, but it wasn't unplayable. Dropping the settings to medium resolved the issue. I'm not sure if I'm just fortunate when it comes to avoiding game issues, but many negative reviews seem to stem from unrealistic expectations.

original: +rpg levelling +wide-variety of ship types +physics-based movement for both ships and projectiles/missles +easy-to-learn resource management +dark humored -grind intensive (if under utilizing the civvy station types) -sub-par ai teammates -low variety of equipment types -low variety of levelling skills (that is, no branching) listen, this game is fun as hell. Despite my minuses up there, there is still some variety and strategy to be had. It starts off fast and still really picks up. Even though there's a low variety of equipment, it still feels like there's always another ship to unlock or skill to level up. The best way to increase the life of this game is the mods. Fight for universe is easily the star, but big fight for beef is also very good.
polished: This game boasts several engaging features, including RPG levelling, a diverse array of ship types, and physics-based movement for both ships and projectiles. The resource management system is easy to learn, and the game's dark humor adds to its appeal. However, it can be grind-intensive if the civilian station types are underutilized. Unfortunately, the AI teammates are sub-par, and the variety of equipment types and levelling skills is limited, with no branching options. Despite these drawbacks, the game remains enjoyable, offering some variety and strategy. It starts off quickly and maintains a fast pace. The low variety of equipment is somewhat mitigated by the constant availability of new ships to unlock and skills to level up. To extend the game's lifespan, mods are highly recommended. Fight for Universe is a standout, while Big Fight for Beef is also noteworthy.

original: World leaders gather to face uncertainty more than 2,000 business and political leaders from around the globe are arriving in the swiss mountain resort davos for the annual world economic forum (wef). For five days, they will discuss issues ranging from china's economic power to iraq's future after this sunday's elections. Uk prime minister tony blair and south african president thabo mbeki are among the more than 20 government leaders and heads of state leaders attending the meeting. Unlike previous years, protests against the wef are expected to be muted. Anti-globalisation campaigners have called off a demonstration planned for the weekend. The brazilian city of porto alegre will host the rival world social forum, timed to run in parallel with the wef's ritzier event in davos.
polished: More than 2,000 business and political leaders from around the globe are arriving in the Swiss mountain resort of Davos for the annual World Economic Forum (WEF). Over the course of five days, they will engage in discussions on a wide range of issues, including China's growing economic power and the future of Iraq following this Sunday's elections. UK Prime Minister Tony Blair and South African President Thabo Mbeki are among the over 20 government leaders and heads of state attending the meeting. Unlike previous years, protests against the WEF are expected to be subdued. Anti-globalisation campaigners have called off a demonstration planned for the weekend. The Brazilian city of Porto Alegre will host the rival World Social Forum, timed to run in parallel with the WEF's event in Davos.

original: Deadline nears for fiat-gm deal fiat and general motors (gm) have until midnight on 1 february to settle a disagreement over a potential takeover. The deadline marks the point at which fiat will gain the right to sell its car division to gm, part of an alliance agreed in 2000. Gm, whose own european operations are losing money, no longer wants to own the unprofitable fiat unit. Reports of deadlocked talks sent fiat shares down 1.2% on tuesday, after monday's 4% gain on hopes of a payoff. The us firm is thought to be offering about $2bn (£1.06bn) to extricate itself from the arrangement. It has argued the deal was voided by fiat's decision to sell off fiat's finance arm and halve gm's stake via a capital-raising effort. The 2000 deal resulted from a race between gm and daimlerchrysler to ally with fiat.
polished: Deadline nears for Fiat-GM deal. Fiat and General Motors (GM) have until midnight on 1 February to resolve a disagreement over a potential takeover. The deadline marks the point at which Fiat will gain the right to sell its car division to GM, part of an alliance agreed in 2000. GM, whose own European operations are struggling financially, no longer wants to own the unprofitable Fiat unit. Reports of deadlocked talks sent Fiat shares down 1.2% on Tuesday, following Monday's 4% gain on hopes of a payoff. The US firm is thought to be offering approximately $2 billion (£1.06 billion) to extricate itself from the arrangement. It has argued the deal was voided by Fiat's decision to sell off its finance arm and halve GM's stake via a capital-raising effort.

original: Cardinal criticises iraq war cost billions of pounds spent on conflict in iraq and in the middle east should have been used to reduce poverty, cardinal cormac murphy-o'connor has said. The head of the catholic church in england and wales made the comments on bbc radio 4 and will re-iterate his stance in his christmas midnight mass. The cardinal used a christmas message to denounce the war in iraq as a "terrible" waste of money. He and the archbishop of canterbury have both spoken out about the war. Speaking on bbc radio 4's thought for the day slot, he criticised the fact that "billions" have been spent on war, instead of being used to bring people "out of dire poverty and malnourishment and disease". The cardinal said 2005 should be the year for campaigning to "make history poverty".

In a Christmas message, the cardinal denounced the war in Iraq as a "terrible" waste of resources. Both he and the Archbishop of Canterbury have publicly spoken out against the war. original: British stars denied major oscars british hopes of winning major oscars were dashed as uk stars failed to win acting and directing prizes. Despite three nominations, mike leigh's vera drake failed to take the director or screenplay awards and there was no prize for star imelda staunton. Kate winslet also lost to best actress hilary swank, while clive owen and sophie okonedo failed to win best supporting actor awards. The uk's andrea arnold won the short film award for her gritty drama wasp. Arnold, who presented children's television shows number 73 and motormouth in the 1980s, said it was "totally overwhelming" to win. Wasp tells the story of a single mother living on the breadline, beating films by fellow uk nominees gary mckendry and ashvin kumar.
polished: British stars denied major Oscars. British hopes of securing major Oscars were dashed as UK stars failed to win acting and directing prizes.
